hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1)  England had the _____ month in years.
2) Amy says it is backed up by _____ .
3) Amy says we need to stop ______ .

hive_text_custom.text: Freakish means strange or unusual. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I do not understand his freakish behavior.
 There was a freakish storm last night.

hive_text_custom.text: It's kind of indicative of climate change.
Indicative means something is an indication, or sign, for something else. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: Stress can be indicative of something else.A long line at a restaurant is an indication of good food.

hive_text_custom.text: I think it's hard to deny really.
If something is hard to deny, it is difficult to prove it is untrue. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: It is hard to deny that Brazil produces great football players.It is hard to deny that cars contribute to global warming.

hive_text_custom.text: It's backed up by evidence and facts.

hive_vocab.examples: He backed up his statement with hard facts.He backed up his claim of neglect with photos of the damage.

hive_text_custom.text: It's a very sort of complex issue.

hive_vocab.examples: This is a complex problem.We have a complex filing system at work.

hive_text_custom.text: We can't continue cutting down acres and acres  of trees.
An acre is a large measurement of land (about .4 hectares). Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples: We live on five acres of farmland.There are acres and acres of fields where I live.
